intro: Serjania incana, commonly known as the white serjania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its pale yellow to white flowers and woody, often thorny stems. Its leaves are alternate and typically have a rough texture. Serjania incana is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of habitats including forests and open areas.
